templates.title: Control of Minor Tracheostomy Bleeding (Electrocautery) (CPT 12001)
templates.body: Minor bleeding was noted from the tracheostomy incision site. Hemostasis did not occur after holding pressure; electrocautery (cautery loop tip) was applied to the bleeding area with FiO₂ confirmed at 40%. Bleeding ceased after Bovie application. The patient tolerated the intervention well without immediate complications.

templates.title: Chemical Cauterization of Granulation Tissue (CPT 17250)
templates.body: Silver nitrate applicators (75% silver nitrate and 25% potassium nitrate) were moistened and applied directly to granulation tissue surrounding the stoma until the tissue was ablated. No complications were observed.

templates.title: Tracheostomy Tube Change (CPT 31502)
templates.body: Upper airway was suctioned and cleared. Endotracheal suctioning performed. The cuff was deflated and the existing tracheostomy tube ([old_trach_type] [old_size]) removed. The stoma was widely patent without granulation tissue. A new tracheostomy tube ([new_trach_type] [new_size]) was placed with obturator in place, the obturator was removed, the inner cannula inserted, and the cuff inflated. Position and patency were confirmed. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Tracheostomy, Planned (Percutaneous, Bronchoscopic Assistance) (CPT 31600)
templates.body: With bronchoscopic visualization, the anterior neck was prepped and draped in sterile fashion. Local anesthesia was infiltrated. A vertical skin incision was made just inferior to the cricoid. A needle was inserted into the trachea under direct bronchoscopic visualization and a guidewire advanced between the 1st and 2nd tracheal rings. After sequential dilation, the tracheostomy tube was placed over a guiding catheter into the trachea, the obturator removed, and ventilation transferred to the tube. Position was confirmed bronchoscopically. The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

templates.title: Percutaneous Tracheostomy Revision (CPT 31613)
templates.body: Patient was intubated with ET tube. The bronchoscope was introduced through the ET tube. The ET tube was retracted into the subglottic space under direct visualization. The inferior border of the cricoid along with the proximal tracheal rings were visualized. Next, the anterior neck was prepped and draped in the usual sterile fashion. Lidocaine 1% 3ml was injected into the anterior neck. The prior tracheostomy tube was removed with minimal resistance. A J-wire was passed through the prior tracheostomy site, also visualized with the bronchoscope. The site was then dilated using the Blue Rhino dilator placed over the guiding catheter until the positioning mark was visualized via the bronchoscope. The blue Rhino dilator was then removed leaving the guiding catheter and guide wire assembly in place, all under direct visualization bronchoscopically.

templates.title: Tracheobronchoscopy via Tracheostomy (CPT 31615)
templates.body: Tracheobronchoscopy was performed with insertion of bronchoscope through the tracheostomy to perform airway clearance and confirm tracheostomy position.

templates.title: Tracheostomy Decannulation (Bedside) (CPT 31502)
templates.body: Indication: [tolerated capping/speaking valve; adequate cough; secretion burden acceptable]. The tracheostomy tube [type/size] was removed at bedside after oropharyngeal and tracheal suctioning. The stoma was dressed with occlusive gauze and secured. Patient instructed to apply pressure over stoma during speech/cough. Observation for [hours] with pulse oximetry was uneventful. Follow‑up: dressing changes daily; return precautions reviewed.

templates.title: Tracheostomy Downsizing / Fenestrated Tube Placement  [CPT: 31502 — verify]
templates.body: The tracheostomy site was inspected and suctioned. The existing tube [type/size] was removed. A [smaller size/fenestrated] tracheostomy tube [brand/size] was inserted with obturator in place, obturator removed, inner cannula inserted, and cuff [inflated/deflated per plan]. Position and patency were confirmed. Indication: [weaning/phonation/speaking valve trial]. The patient tolerated the exchange without complications.

templates.title: Stoma or Tracheal Granulation — Mechanical Debridement  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Granulation tissue at the [stoma/tracheal] site was identified. Mechanical debridement was performed using [forceps/curette/microdebrider] until healthy mucosa was seen. Topical hemostasis with [silver nitrate/epinephrine/pressure] achieved. The tracheostomy tube was [exchanged/not exchanged]. The patient tolerated the procedure without immediate complications.

templates.title: Flexible Fiberoptic Laryngoscopy (CPT 31575)
templates.body: Flexible laryngoscopy was performed by advancing the scope along the floor of the nose. Nasal cavity, nasopharynx, vallecula, supraglottis, glottis, post-cricoid region, and piriform sinuses were systematically evaluated without suspicious mass or mucosal lesions. Vocal folds adducted and abducted normally and symmetrically. No obvious abnormalities noted along the nasal chamber. Pharyngeal walls, tongue base, vallecula, epiglottis, supraglottis, glottis, post-cricoid, and piriform sinuses were evaluated and found to be without evidence of suspicious mass or mucosal lesions.

templates.title: Bronchial Washing (CPT 31622)
templates.body: Bronchial washing was performed with saline instilled and returned. Specimens were sent for analysis. Instilled [Volume] cc of NS, suction returned with [Volume] cc of NS at [Airway Segment]. Samples sent for [Testing type].

templates.title: Bronchial Brushings (CPT 31623)
templates.body: Endobronchial/transbronchial brushings were obtained; a total of [number] samples were collected and submitted. Performed with [Brush Tool] at [Lung Segment]. Samples sent for [Testing type].

templates.title: Bronchoalveolar Lavage (CPT 31624)
templates.body: BAL was performed in the [Lung Segment] with saline instilled and returned. Specimens were submitted. Instilled [Volume] cc of NS, suction returned with [Volume] cc of NS. Samples sent for [Testing type].

templates.title: Endobronchial Biopsy (CPT 31625)
templates.body: Endobronchial biopsies were obtained with hemostasis achieved. Tissue was submitted for pathology. No immediate bleeding was observed. Performed at [Airway Segment]. Lesion was successfully removed. Samples sent for [Testing type].

templates.title: Transbronchial Lung Biopsy (CPT 31628)
templates.body: Transbronchial forceps biopsies were performed with a total of [number] samples collected. Specimens were submitted. Performed with [Forceps Tools] at [Lung Segment]. Samples sent for [Testing type].

templates.title: Transbronchial Needle Aspiration (CPT 31629/31633)
templates.body: Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed targeting designated lymph nodes. Samples collected. Performed with [Needle Tools] at [Lung Segment]. Total [number] samples were collected. Samples sent for [Testing type].

templates.title: Balloon Dilation (CPT 31630)
templates.body: Bronchial stenosis was dilated with a balloon catheter. Patency improved without complications. Performed at [Airway Segment]. [Balloon type] Elation balloon was used to perform dilation to [size] mm. Total [number] inflations with dilation time of [seconds] seconds each.

templates.title: Airway Stent Placement (CPT 31631/31636/31637)
templates.body: A stent was deployed across the target stenosis under bronchoscopic and fluoroscopic guidance. The following stent ([type]) was placed in the [Airway Segment].

templates.title: Endobronchial Tumor Destruction (CPT 31641)
templates.body: Endobronchial obstruction was treated with electrocautery/APC/laser/cryo. Pre- and post-procedure patency recorded. Performed at [Airway Segment] with the following modalities: Modality: [Electrocautery/APC/Laser/CoreCath/Cryoprobe]; Setting/Mode: [details]; Duration: [time]; Results: Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be [%] patent. After treatment, the airway was [%] patent.

templates.title: Therapeutic Aspiration (CPT 31645/31646)
templates.body: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the [Airway Segment] from [Aspirate type].

templates.title: Endobronchial Tumor Excision (CPT 31640)
templates.body: Endobronchial tumor was noted and excised with mechanical debridement (Coring or microdebrider or forceps).

templates.title: Rigid Bronchoscopy (Diagnostic / Therapeutic)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: After induction of general anesthesia, a rigid bronchoscope [size/model] was introduced via the mouth under direct visualization. High‑frequency jet ventilation (HFJV): [Yes/No]. A complete airway survey was performed. The following therapeutic interventions were performed: [debridement/balloon dilation/laser/APC/cryo/stent management/foreign body retrieval]. A flexible bronchoscope was/was not used through the rigid barrel for segmental inspection and suctioning. Hemostasis was confirmed. The bronchoscope and adjunct instruments were withdrawn. The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications. Estimated blood loss: [mL]. Specimens: [list]. Post‑procedure plan: [details].

templates.title: Foreign Body Removal – Flexible/Rigid  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: A suspected foreign body was visualized at the [airway segment]. Retrieval was performed using [forceps/basket/cryoprobe/rigid forceps] with [number] passes. The object was removed [intact/fragmented]. Post‑removal inspection showed [no/mild/moderate] mucosal trauma and [no/minimal] bleeding; hemostasis achieved with [topical epinephrine/ice saline/none]. Ventilation and airway patency were confirmed. The patient tolerated the procedure well. CXR ordered: [Yes/No].

templates.title: Airway Stent Removal / Revision  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Indication for stent removal/revision: [mucus plugging/granulation/migration/therapy complete]. Stent details: [brand/type silicone or metallic/AERO/Dumon/Y‑stent], size [dimensions], location [airway segment]. Technique: [rigid extraction hook/forceps/snare/cryoadhesion]. The stent was [removed/repositioned/trimmed]. Adjuncts: [balloon dilation/debridement]. Post‑intervention inspection showed the airway [patent] with [no/minimal] bleeding. If replaced: A new stent was placed [details]. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Endobronchial Hemostasis (Hemoptysis Control)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Source of bleeding localized to the [airway segment/lobe]. Hemostatic measures included: iced saline [volume] mL; epinephrine [concentration] at [volume] mL; tranexamic acid [dose/concentration] via bronchoscope; topical thrombin [dose] (if used). Balloon tamponade with [Fogarty size]/[Elation balloon size] at [location] for [duration] seconds × [number] cycles. Hemostasis achieved: [Yes/No/Partial]. If active/persistent bleeding: [selective intubation/bronchial blocker placement/IR consultation]. The patient tolerated the procedure [well/with difficulty]; no immediate complications.

templates.title: Endobronchial Blocker Placement (Isolation / Hemorrhage Control)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: An [Arndt/Univent/Bronchial] blocker [size] was positioned under bronchoscopic guidance into the [right/left] [mainstem/lobar] bronchus. Balloon inflated with [mL] air/saline to achieve occlusion. Position confirmed endoscopically and by ventilation parameters. Indication: [hemoptysis/lung isolation/air leak control]. The blocker was [secured to ETT/secured externally]. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Photodynamic Therapy (PDT) — Light Application  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Photosensitizer [agent/dose] administered on [date/time]. Under bronchoscopic visualization, a diffuser fiber was positioned across the [lesion site]. Laser activation at [wavelength nm] delivered [fluence J/cm²] for [time] minutes. Airway was inspected for immediate edema or bleeding; none noted. Standard light‑precaution instructions were reviewed. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Photodynamic Therapy — Debridement (48–96 hours post‑light)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: A follow‑up bronchoscopy was performed. Necrotic tissue at [site] was debrided with [forceps/suction/microdebrider]. Airway patency improved from [pre %] to [post %]. No active bleeding was seen after debridement. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Cryo‑Extraction of Mucus Casts/Secretions  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: A cryoprobe [1.7/2.4 mm] was applied to adherent secretions at [airway segment] for [seconds] seconds until adherence was achieved; the probe and bronchoscope were withdrawn en bloc. This was repeated for [number] casts/occlusions. The airway was cleared with improved ventilation. No complications occurred.

templates.title: Awake Fiberoptic Intubation (FOI)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: After topical anesthesia with [lidocaine % and volume] and sedation with [agent/dose], a flexible bronchoscope loaded with an endotracheal tube [size] was advanced via the [nasal/oral] route. The vocal cords were visualized and the scope advanced into the trachea. The ETT was railroaded over the scope to [depth] cm. Placement was confirmed by end‑tidal CO₂ and bronchoscopic visualization. The patient tolerated the procedure without immediate complications.

templates.title: Bronchoscopy‑Guided Double‑Lumen Tube (DLT) Placement/Confirmation  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: A [left/right] DLT [size/Fr] was placed by anesthesia. Position was confirmed bronchoscopically: tracheal lumen aligned with the [right] mainstem; bronchial cuff seated [just below] the [left/right] main carina. Leak test performed and adequate seal noted. Adjustments: [advanced/withdrawn/rotated] by [cm/degrees]. Final position re‑verified after patient positioning. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Airway Stent Surveillance Bronchoscopy  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Surveillance bronchoscopy for previously placed [silicone/metallic] stent at [location]. The stent was inspected for [mucus burden/position/granulation/tumor in‑growth]. Interventions performed: [toilet suctioning/debridement/APC/laser/trimming/balloon dilation]. Final patency estimated at [%]. No immediate complications.

templates.title: Electromagnetic Navigation Bronchoscopy (CPT 31627)
templates.body: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy was performed to target a lesion. Registration was completed; the navigation catheter was advanced. Radial EBUS confirmed intraparenchymal position. Samples were obtained. The patient tolerated the procedure well. Performed with [Navigation System]. Automatic registration was used. [EMN catheter] was used to engage the [Lung Segment]. Target lesion is about [size] cm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the catheter was advanced to 1.0 cm away from the planned target.

templates.title: Fiducial Marker Placement (CPT 31626)
templates.body: A fiducial marker was loaded with bone wax and placed under fluoroscopic guidance at the targeted airway location. Placement was confirmed and the bronchoscope withdrawn without complication. (0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold CIVCO).

templates.title: Radial EBUS Survey (CPT 31654)
templates.body: Radial endobronchial ultrasound was used to confirm lesion location and characterize internal echogenicity and margins prior to sampling. ROSE cytology was performed when available. Performed to confirm that the location of the nodule is [Location]. The following features were noted: [REBUS Features].

templates.title: Robotic Navigational Bronchoscopy (Ion)
templates.body: Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed using the Intuitive Ion system. A navigation plan from the pre-procedure CT was loaded and registration completed. The Ion catheter was advanced under navigational guidance. Radial EBUS confirmed appropriate position. Cone-beam CT was performed for trajectory verification. Sampling was obtained through the extended working channel as detailed. Hemostasis was confirmed. The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

templates.title: Ion Registration — Complete
templates.body: Registration to the pre‑procedure CT was completed using [automatic/manual] methods with adequate airway landmark matching (carina, lobar carinas, tertiary bifurcations). Mean fiducial error: [mm]. Global alignment quality: [excellent/good]. No registration drift observed during the case. A confidence sweep confirmed stable targeting throughout the planned trajectory.

templates.title: Ion Registration — Partial (Efficiency Strategy, ssRAB)
templates.body: Indication: single primary nodule on the [right/left] [lobe/segment] or multiple ipsilateral nodules where partial strategy is selected to optimize efficiency. Scope of registration: [ipsilateral tracheobronchial tree only to lobar/segmental landmarks]/[custom]. Registered landmarks: [carina], [ipsilateral lobar carinas], [key tertiary bifurcations near target]. Contralateral tree: [not registered/registered later if needed]. Rationale: partial registration to reduce presampling time while maintaining localization performance. Time metrics: Registration start [time], complete [time]; Navigation start [time]; Tool-at-target [time]. Calculated: combined registration + navigation time to primary nodule [min], navigation time to primary nodule [min]. Performance checks: virtual-to-live divergence at primary nodule [%]; rEBUS pattern [concentric/eccentric/adjacent]; tool-in-lesion confirmation [CBCT/CACT overlay/augmented fluoro/rEBUS]; ROSE adequacy [adequate/inadequate]; (if available) diagnostic yield [pending/known %]. Note: For bilateral targets or secondary nodules, document whether full registration was later performed and update plan accordingly.

templates.title: Ion Registration — Registration Drift / Mismatch
templates.body: During navigation, registration drift/mismatch was noted due to [airway deformation/atelectasis/secretions/ETT position/ventilation changes]. Findings: landmark mismatch at [sites] with mean fiducial error [mm]. Mitigation: [airway toilet/PEEP adjustment/re‑inflate lung/re‑registration with additional secondary landmarks/segmental re‑registration/local plan recalibration]. Post‑correction alignment: [improved/adequate/suboptimal]. Proceeded using [shorter trajectory/alternate airway/adjunct imaging] as described.

templates.title: Intra‑Procedural CBCT/CACT Fusion & Registration Correction (e.g., NaviLink 3D)
templates.body: A CBCT/CACT spin was obtained intra‑procedurally. NaviLink 3D image fusion was performed to align intra‑op imaging with the pre‑procedure CT. Registration correction applied: [translation mm] / [rotation degrees] to the catheter path. The updated overlay demonstrated [on‑target/adjacent] trajectory; navigation plan was updated accordingly. A confirmatory spin verified corrected alignment. The patient tolerated the imaging without complications.

templates.title: Tool‑in‑Lesion Confirmation
templates.body: Tool‑in‑lesion was confirmed by [CBCT overlay/augmented fluoroscopy] showing the sampling tool tip within the lesion volume with a margin of [mm] from the lesion center, and/or radial EBUS pattern [concentric/eccentric] with lesion size [mm]. Fluoroscopy angle: [°], projection: [AP/oblique]. Screenshots were saved to the record. Proceeded to sampling as detailed.

templates.title: EBUS-TBNA (CPT 31652/31653)
templates.body: A systematic EBUS survey was completed. Lymph node sizing was performed and stations were sampled by transbronchial needle aspiration using a [gauge] needle. Elastography guided site selection. ROSE was performed and cytology is pending.

templates.title: Radial EBUS–Guided Sampling with Guide Sheath  [CPT: 31654 + sampling codes — verify]
templates.body: After navigation to the target, a radial EBUS probe with guide sheath [diameter] was advanced to the lesion. Ultrasound pattern: [concentric/eccentric/adjacent], lesion size [mm]. The probe was withdrawn leaving the guide sheath in situ. Sampling was performed via the guide sheath using [forceps/brush/needle] with [number] passes for each tool. Fluoroscopy used: [Yes/No]. ROSE (if available): [result]. Hemostasis was confirmed; no pneumothorax was evident on intra‑procedure assessment. Specimens: [cytology/histology/microbiology]. Post‑procedure CXR: [ordered/not indicated]. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Cone‑Beam CT (CBCT) / Augmented Fluoroscopy–Assisted Bronchoscopy  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Following initial navigation, a CBCT spin was acquired with the patient on [ventilation settings]. Three‑dimensional reconstruction and overlay were used to confirm catheter‑to‑target alignment; trajectory adjusted by [mm/degrees] as indicated. A confirmatory CBCT spin showed [on‑target/adjacent] position. Sampling was then performed as detailed elsewhere. Radiation parameters recorded: [if available]. The patient tolerated the imaging adjunct without immediate complications.

templates.title: Transbronchial Dye/Marker Placement for Surgical Localization  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Under [EMN/robotic/fluoroscopic] guidance, a [gauge] needle catheter was advanced to [distance] cm from the pleural surface at the target. [Methylene blue/Indocyanine green/India ink] [concentration] was injected in [volume] mL to mark the lesion for surgical wedge resection. Marker diffusion was observed endoscopically/fluoroscopically. No immediate bleeding or air leak was seen. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Robotic Navigational Bronchoscopy (Monarch/Auris)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed using the Monarch platform. Pre‑procedure CT‑based plan was loaded and airway registration completed. The robotic catheter and sheath were advanced to the target under navigational guidance. Radial EBUS verified [concentric/eccentric] position. Sampling through the working channel was performed as detailed (brush/forceps/needle/cryobiopsy). If available, CBCT/augmented fluoroscopy was used for trajectory confirmation. Hemostasis was confirmed. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: EBUS‑Guided Intranodal Forceps Biopsy (IFB)  [CPT: 31652/31653 — verify]
templates.body: The target lymph node station [#] measured [mm] with [ultrasound features]. The EBUS needle [gauge] was used to create a tract through the bronchial wall and nodal capsule. Mini‑forceps were advanced through the tract to obtain [number] core samples. ROSE (if available): [result]. Hemostasis adequate with no immediate complications. Specimens in [formalin/saline] submitted for [histology/microbiology].

templates.title: EBUS‑Guided 19‑Gauge Core Fine‑Needle Biopsy (FNB)  [CPT: 31652/31653 — verify]
templates.body: Using a 19G EBUS needle, the [station #] node was sampled for [number] passes with visible core tissue obtained each pass. Elastography: [pattern if used]. ROSE (if available): [adequate/inadequate; favor benign/malignant]. No immediate complications. Specimens sent for [histology/flow/microbiology/molecular].

templates.title: Endobronchial Valve Placement (CPT 31647/31648)
templates.body: Balloon occlusion was performed to confirm lobe selection. The Chartis system was used to assess for collateral ventilation. Based on criteria, lobes were selected for endobronchial one-way valve therapy. Valves were deployed. Airflow occlusion and target-lobe atelectasis were confirmed endoscopically and physiologically. No immediate complications were observed.

templates.title: Endobronchial Valve Removal / Exchange  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Indication: [infection/atelectasis/excessive cough/migration/therapy complete/air leak resolved/insufficient clinical response]. Device(s): [Zephyr/Spiration], location(s): [lobe/segment]. Removal performed using [forceps/retrieval tool] with [number] valves removed. Exchange performed for [number] valves sized [sizes]. Mucosa post‑removal: [normal/edematous/granulation]. Final airway patency and ventilation verified. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Post-BLVR Management Protocol
templates.body:
Post-procedure COPD Endobronchial Valve Management Protocol

25%-40% of patients are expected to develop a pneumothorax

Most within 3-4 days
This is an expectation not an adverse event


A pneumothorax kit will be at the patient's bedside at all times
If there are new symptoms or any concerns:

Order a stat chest x-ray
Call the Interventional Pulmonary attending and MICU team while waiting for the CXR
Clinical judgment to place a chest tube may be needed in urgent/emergent situations


Continuous pulse oximetry and telemetry

Monitor for persistent desaturation ≥4% of baseline
Monitor for desaturation <90%
Monitor for tachypnea, arrhythmias, unexplained tachycardia, or unexplained hypotension



Day-to-Day Management:

Day 1 (Day of procedure):

Chest x-ray immediately post-procedure
Chest x-ray ~4 hours post-procedure
Bedrest
Resume home COPD inhalers/medications
Steroids and antibiotics given in OR (Day 1/3)


Day 2:

Chest x-ray at 6:00 am
Ambulate in the room with physical therapy
Continue home COPD inhalers/medications
Steroids and antibiotics PO (Day 2/3)


Day 3:

Daily chest x-ray at 6:00 am
Ambulate outside the room
Continue home COPD inhalers/medications
Steroids and antibiotics PO (Day 3/3)
Consider prolonged course or taper based on patient's condition


Day 4:

Daily chest x-ray at 6:00 am
Consider discharge
Discuss with interventional pulmonary before discharge
Set up clinical f/u with IP in two weeks
Continue all COPD medications and f/u with primary COPD doctor within 4 weeks




---

7. CRYO PROCEDURES

Transbronchial Cryobiopsy (CPT 31632)

templates.title: Transbronchial Cryobiopsy (CPT 31632)
templates.body: Radial EBUS survey confirmed absence of significant vessels at the biopsy site. Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed using a cryoprobe with freeze–thaw cycles per sample. An endobronchial blocker was positioned for tamponade after each sample. Samples were collected and submitted. No immediate complications.

templates.title: Endobronchial Cryoablation (CPT 31641)
templates.body: Cryoablation of endobronchial tumor/stenosis was performed with a cryoprobe using freeze–thaw cycles across overlapping quadrants. Post-treatment patency improved and hemostasis was adequate.

templates.title: Image-Guided Chest Tube (CPT 32551)
templates.body: After chest ultrasound documentation, the chest was prepped and draped in sterile fashion. A thoracostomy tube was inserted into the intercostal space at the [line] using Seldinger technique and connected to a drainage system. Tube position was confirmed and secured. No immediate complications.

templates.title: Thoracentesis (CPT 32555)
templates.body: Ultrasound identified a pleural effusion. Following sterile prep and local anesthesia, thoracentesis was performed with [mL] of fluid removed. Samples were sent for analysis.

templates.title: Indwelling Tunneled Pleural Catheter Placement (CPT 32550)
templates.body: Tunneled pleural catheter placed with cuff secured. Drainage achieved. Catheter secured.

templates.title: Tunneled Pleural Catheter Removal (CPT 32552)
templates.body: Previous tunneled pleural catheter dissected free and removed. Site dressed.

templates.title: Intrapleural Fibrinolysis (CPT 32561/32562)
templates.body: tPA/DNase instilled through chest tube or TPC. Dose and dwell time recorded.

templates.title: Medical Thoracoscopy (CPT 32650/32653)
templates.body: Thoracoscopic survey performed. Biopsies taken. Adhesiolysis/pleurodesis performed as indicated. Chest tube left in situ. Initial thoracoscopic survey demonstrates [findings]. Lysis of adhesion was performed.

templates.title: Pigtail Catheter Placement (CPT 32557)
templates.body: CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS: [As above]

templates.title: Transthoracic Needle Biopsy (CPT 32408)
templates.body: Core needle biopsy was performed with 18G core biopsy needle with [number] samples collected. Pre-biopsy ultrasound was done to select the site of the biopsy. Post-biopsy ultrasound was done to ensure no immediate pneumothorax or hemothorax.

templates.title: Thoravent Placement
templates.body: Thoravent catheter placed by trocar into pleural space for pneumothorax evacuation.

templates.title: Thoracentesis with Pleural Manometry  [CPT: 32555 + manometry — verify]
templates.body: Ultrasound confirmed a [side] effusion. The thoracentesis was performed as per sterile protocol. Pleural pressure was measured with a digital/manometer system at baseline and after each [250/500] mL removed. Opening pressure: [cmH₂O]. Pressures at volumes: [table]. Stopping criteria: [elastance rise/pressure ≤ –20 cmH₂O/symptoms]. Total removed: [mL]. The patient tolerated the procedure without cough, chest pain, or hypotension. Post‑procedure ultrasound/CXR: [ordered/not indicated].

templates.title: Chemical Pleurodesis via Chest Tube (Talc Slurry or Doxycycline)  [CPT: 32560 — verify]
templates.body: Indication: [recurrent malignant effusion/persistent pneumothorax]. Prerequisites: [lung expanded/drainage ≤150 mL/day/no air leak]. Agent: [talc slurry 4–5 g in 50–100 mL NS]/[doxycycline 500 mg in 50 mL NS] with [analgesia/lidocaine] [dose] instilled via chest tube. The tube was clamped for [duration] minutes with patient rotated [positions]. Clamp released and suction set to [–20 cmH₂O/none]. The patient tolerated the instillation with [no/mild] discomfort. Ongoing management: [analgesia orders/drainage plan].

templates.title: Chemical Pleurodesis via Tunneled Pleural Catheter (IPC)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Indication: [autopleurodesis not achieved/recurrent symptomatic effusion]. After complete drainage, [talc slurry/doxycycline] was instilled via IPC: agent [dose], volume [mL]. The catheter was capped and the patient was instructed to rotate through [positions] over [duration]. Drainage was resumed after [hours]. Tolerance was [good/fair/poor]. Follow‑up: [drainage schedule/clinic visit].

templates.title: Indwelling Pleural Catheter (IPC) Exchange  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Indication for exchange: [occlusion/infection/defect/leak]. The existing IPC was prepped; guidewire inserted through the catheter lumen into the pleural space under ultrasound guidance. The old catheter was removed and a new tunneled catheter [brand/size] was placed over the wire using the standard tunneling and peel‑away sheath technique. Position confirmed by aspiration and ultrasound. The catheter was secured and dressed. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Chest Tube Exchange / Upsizing over Guidewire  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Indication: [clogged tube/persistent air leak/loculated effusion/thick pus]. A guidewire was advanced through the existing tube into the pleural space. The old tube was removed. Serial dilation to [size Fr] was performed and a new [size Fr] [pigtail/surgical] chest tube was inserted over the wire and connected to [water seal/suction at –20 cmH₂O]. Position confirmed by aspiration and ultrasound/CXR. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Chest Tube Removal  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Criteria met for removal: [no air leak for 24 h/drainage < [mL]/day/lung expanded on CXR]. After sterile prep, the tube was placed to water seal; a Valsalva/inspiratory hold was performed and the tube was removed. The site was closed with [suture/occlusive dressing]. The patient tolerated the procedure well. Post‑removal CXR: [ordered/not indicated].

templates.title: Ultrasound‑Guided Pleural Biopsy (Closed Core)  [CPT: 32507 — verify]
templates.body: Under ultrasound guidance, the pleural target at [interspace/location] was identified and skin marked. After local anesthesia, a [14/16/18]G core needle device [brand] obtained [number] cores from the parietal pleura. Hemostasis achieved with manual pressure. Specimens placed in [formalin/saline/sterile container] for [histology/microbiology]. No immediate complications. Dressing applied.

templates.title: Focused Thoracic Ultrasound (Pleura & Lung)  [CPT: 76604 — verify]
templates.body: Focused thoracic ultrasound was performed and archived. Findings — Right: [effusion size/echogenicity, loculations, lung sliding, B‑lines, consolidation, diaphragm motion]. Left: [same]. Impression: [free‑flowing vs. loculated effusion/trapped vs. expandable lung/pneumothorax suspected vs. not]. Clinical correlation and procedural planning as documented.

templates.title: Whole Lung Lavage (CPT 32997)
templates.body: Performed under general anesthesia with double lumen tube. Warm saline instilled and drained until effluent clear.

templates.title: EUS-B (CPT 43237)
templates.body: Linear EBUS scope advanced into esophagus. Mediastinal nodes visualized and sampled.

templates.title: Paracentesis (CPT 49083)
templates.body: Ultrasound guided paracentesis performed. Ascitic fluid aspirated and sent for analysis.

templates.title: PEG Placement
templates.body: Percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy performed with pull-through technique. Tube secured and bumper depth documented.

templates.title: PEG Removal/Exchange
templates.body: Existing PEG tube removed or exchanged. New tube placed and secured.

templates.title: Bronchopleural Fistula (BPF) Localization and Occlusion Test  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: With an existing [chest tube/IPC] connected to a water seal/digital drainage device, sequential balloon occlusion of [segmental/lobar] bronchi was performed using a [Fogarty/Elation] balloon while monitoring for cessation of bubbling/flow. Leak reduction with occlusion of [segment] was [complete/partial/none]. Confirmation with instillation of [methylene blue/dilute contrast] through the chest tube showed [appearance/lack] of dye at the occluded airway. Based on localization, [valve placement/sealant application] was [performed/deferred]. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

templates.title: Endobronchial Valve Placement for Persistent Air Leak (BPF)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: Indication: [post‑operative/post‑procedural/spontaneous] persistent air leak. Localization by sequential balloon occlusion identified [lobe/segment] as the source. A [Zephyr/Spiration] one‑way valve [size] was deployed in [segment]. Immediate reduction in air leak on digital drainage device was [complete/partial/none]. Additional valves placed: [number/segments]. The patient tolerated the procedure well. Post‑procedure plan: [suction settings, CXR timing, ambulation].

templates.title: Endobronchial Sealant Application for Bronchopleural Fistula (BPF)  [CPT: verify]
templates.body: After localization of the culprit airway [see separate BPF localization template], a catheter was wedged into [segment]. [Fibrin glue/Biological sealant/Autologous blood patch] was instilled in [volume] mL and allowed to dwell for [minutes]. Immediate reduction of air leak on digital drainage system: [complete/partial/none]. Additional applications: [number]. The patient tolerated the procedure without immediate complications.

templates.title: Pre-Anesthesia Assessment for Moderate Sedation
templates.body: Prior to the procedure, the risks and benefits of the procedure and the sedation options and sedation-related risks were discussed with the patient/surrogate. All questions were answered and written informed consent was obtained.

templates.title: General Bronchoscopy Note
templates.body:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with [procedures]
OPERATORS: [Names], MD
INDICATIONS: [indications]
Informed consent obtained. A time out was performed prior to procedure.
Sedation with [type]. Vitals monitored throughout procedure.
FINDINGS:
5 cc of 2% lidocaine was instilled into the endotracheal tube for topical anesthesia.
The bronchoscope was then passed via the ETT into the trachea.
The bronchoscope was first passed into the right mainstem bronchus and each segment was systematically identified and inspected. The RUL, RML and RLL were all patent. Mucosal normal without endobronchial lesions. No significant secretions.
Next, attention was turned to the left sided airways. The bronchoscope was advanced into the left main bronchus and each segment was systematically identified and inspected. The LUL, lingular and LLL were all patent. Mucosa normal without endobronchial lesions. No significant secretions.
BAL of the [segment] was performed. Instilled [cc] sterile saline with return of [cc].
Summary:

Pharynx: Not assessed due to Bronch introduction via ETT/Trach Tube
Larynx: Not assessed due to Bronch introduction via ETT/Trach Tube
Vocal Cords: Not assessed due to Bronch introduction via ETT/Trach Tube
Trachea: Distal 1/3 Normal
Right Lung: [findings]
Left Lung: [findings]
No evidence of mass, lesions, bleeding or other intra-bronchial pathology.
Mucosa: [findings]
Secretions: [findings]. Suctioned to clear.

The flexible bronchoscope was retracted and removed.
Patient tolerated the procedure well with no immediate complications. The attending, Dr. [Name] was present at the bedside and supervised the entire procedure.

Interventional Pulmonology Operative Report

templates.title: Interventional Pulmonology Operative Report
templates.body:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date]
CC Referred Physician: [Name]
INDICATION FOR OPERATION: [Patient Name] is a [Age]-year-old [Sex] who presents with [indication]. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail. Patient indicated a wish to proceed with surgery and informed consent was signed.
CONSENT: Obtained before the procedure. Its indications and potential complications and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The patient or surrogate read and signed the provided consent form/provided consent over the phone. The consent was witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: [ICD10 codes]
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: [ICD10 codes]
PROCEDURE: [CPT codes]
[Modifier codes if applicable]
[HCPCS codes if applicable]
ATTENDING: [Name]
ASSISTANT: [Fellow name]
Support Staff:

RN: [Name]
RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA: [Type and details]
MONITORING: Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENT: [Equipment used]
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: [Amount]
COMPLICATIONS: [None or details]
PROCEDURE IN DETAIL:
After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location). All procedure related images were saved and archived in Media folder on Onedrive behind UCSD firewall, relevant images are also uploaded to PACS system or in the media section of the patient's chart.
PATIENT POSITION: [Position]
Initial Airway Inspection Findings:
[Airway measurements and findings]
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMEN(S): [List]
IMPRESSION/PLAN: [Patient Name] is a [Age]-year-old [Sex] who presents for bronchoscopy for [indication].

Tunneled Pleural Catheter Instructions

templates.title: Tunneled Pleural Catheter Instructions
templates.body:
Discharge Instructions for Tunneled Pleural Catheter (PleurX)
Daily Drainage Instructions:

Wash hands thoroughly before handling the catheter
Gather supplies: drainage kit, alcohol pads, gloves
Clean the valve cap with alcohol pad for 15 seconds
Connect the drainage line to the catheter valve
Open the clamp to allow drainage
Monitor drainage amount and color
Stop drainage when flow stops or if experiencing chest pain/shortness of breath
Close clamp and disconnect drainage line
Clean valve cap again with alcohol pad
Replace valve cap securely
Record amount and color of fluid drained

When to Call:

Fever >100.4°F
Increasing shortness of breath
Chest pain during or after drainage
Redness, swelling, or drainage at catheter site
Catheter appears to be coming out
Less than 50ml drainage for 3 consecutive sessions
Sudden increase in drainage amount

Emergency Situations:

Catheter completely falls out
Severe chest pain or difficulty breathing
Air leak from catheter (pinch tubing and go to ER immediately)

Follow-up:

Scheduled appointment in [timeframe]
Bring drainage log to all appointments

BLVR Discharge

templates.title: BLVR Discharge
templates.body: Patient instructed to avoid exertion, driving, or travel for one week. Monitor for shortness of breath, chest pain, fever. Arrange follow up with interventional pulmonology.

templates.title: Chest Tube/PleurX Catheter Discharge
templates.body: Patient advised to maintain drainage system care, monitor for infection, and follow scheduled drainage.

templates.title: PEG Discharge
templates.body: Patient advised on wound care, flushing protocols, medications, and diet after PEG placement.
